p: Adult mosquitoes of Aedes albopictus were obtained from the National Institute of Parasitic Diseases at Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention based in Shanghai and were raised at 26±2°C, 60~80% relative humidity, and a 12:12 light: dark cycle. The larvae were raised on a diet of rat food. Adults were provided with 10% (g/v) sucrose solution. Adult mosquitoes aged between three and five days post emergence from larvae were used as experiment objects.
